summary: This document outlines the confidential plea negotiation terms for Jeffrey Epstein, detailing the state charges he would plead guilty to, the agreed-upon sentence of at least two years in prison, and conditions including waiving appeals and not contesting jurisdiction in potential civil suits by victims. It also states that federal investigations would be closed upon his state court plea and sentencing.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the plea negotiations, agreeing to plead guilty to state charges of lewd and lascivious battery on a child, solicitation of minors, and engaging in sexual activity with minors.

events.title: Epstein Plea Agreement Negotiation
events.description: Confidential negotiations outline terms where Epstein would plead guilty to state charges in Palm Beach County, agree to a joint sentencing recommendation of at least two years in prison, waive appeals, and not contest jurisdiction in potential civil suits by victims.

events.title: Closure of Federal Investigations
events.description: The FBI and U.S. Attorney's Office agree to close their investigations into Epstein after he enters his state court plea and is sentenced.

keyFacts: Epstein agreed to plead guilty to state charges including lewd and lascivious battery on a child, solicitation of minors for prostitution, and engaging in sexual activity with minors.
The plea deal included a binding joint recommendation for Epstein to serve at least two years in prison without probation or community control.
Epstein waived all challenges to the information and the right to appeal as part of the agreement.
Epstein agreed not to contest jurisdiction or victim status in potential civil suits under 18 U.S.C. ยง 2255 by victims identified in the federal investigation.
The FBI and U.S. Attorney's Office would close their investigations upon Epstein's state court plea and sentencing.
